TopicTitle: [1.12.X] Tantares - Stockalike Soyuz and MIR [16.1][28.05.2024][{Proton Revamp]

Articles.Content:
Good job! Looks really nice.

Thanks!

The slants at the bottom of the (radial tanks?) on the real Proton, slant upward, exposing part of the engine assembly. It's due to these pieces indicated (don't know what they're for. Possibly aerodynamic stability or exhaust protection?)

http://i.imgur.com/FmKOhkx.png

Just so you know.

Eh, you know I have got this wrong.

Thanks for pointing this out. Possibly I will change it, but first I need to model the nozzles and see how they will look.

Modelling the nozzles separate so that they can gimbal all nice.

Why would it matter anyway, you're not doing the real Proton after all, you're making some ALV thingy to shoot little green men into space...

Anyway, looks great!
Great looking stuff as always Beale!

So much yes; love it!!!

Yet again you outdo yourself Beale!

Soooo... What are your plans for the future of this mod-pack (long term projects etc.)?

Why would it matter anyway, you're not doing the real Proton after all, you're making some ALV thingy to shoot little green men into space...

Anyway, looks great!

Beale, When your completely done with all your Soviet/Russian Spacecraft, Could you make more 'Merican,Japanese,Indian,Chinese and European Spacecraft? Such as the Orion,Mercury,Skylab,Gemini,Apollo,MOL,CST-100,ISRO Orbital Vehicle,HTV,Shuguang,Kankoh-maru, and the Dragon Spacecraft?
Could we maybe have the markings on the side of the rocket in red for a little more color? A flag decal wouldn't be too bad either.

Beale, When your completely done with all your Soviet/Russian Spacecraft, Could you make more 'Merican,Japanese,Indian,Chinese and European Spacecraft? Such as the Orion,Mercury,Skylab,Gemini,Apollo,MOL,CST-100,ISRO Orbital Vehicle,HTV,Shuguang,Kankoh-maru, and the Dragon Spacecraft?

I have just completed Beales tutorial on things for the purpose of making my own mods based on some of those. Specifically Mercury, Gemini, and some service modules.

Of course I have no idea if I have any talent in the area yet, but if you feel like trying it out I would recommend the tutorial.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/entries/3232-Part-Modding-Tutorial-1-5-Modeling
Everyone is making huge rocket and I'm just sitting there, recreating Vostok 3 and 4, the first group flight.

I like this ethos!

Beale, When your completely done with all your Soviet/Russian Spacecraft, Could you make more 'Merican,Japanese,Indian,Chinese and European Spacecraft? Such as the Orion,Mercury,Skylab,Gemini,Apollo,MOL,CST-100,ISRO Orbital Vehicle,HTV,Shuguang,Kankoh-maru, and the Dragon Spacecraft?

I doubt it, it's really out of scope for me.

Things like the Fuji and ATV are more one off. little fun projects.

In reality, there is an endless pit of Russian stuff, and I am digging that pit deeper (I'm not complaining, I want to reach the bottom!)

Could we maybe have the markings on the side of the rocket in red for a little more color? A flag decal wouldn't be too bad either.

Quite likely! If not red, then orange.

Flag decal, I will have that one the second stage.

And new ATV needs flag decal...

Cool SSTO!

You can backup the existing engine: rename the folder and part.cfg's name to ALV_Engine_A1, or something else, then you can keep both .

For the new one, balance is:

Mass = 16 (17 maybe?)

maxThrust = 2700

LF = 9720

OX = = 11880

So, it has quite a lot more fuel than the previous ALV, but now has a Dry/Wet ratio in line with stock 3.75m tanks.

Edited January 3, 2015 by Beale

Beale, you might want to take a look at the proposal on the Russian Moon base:

Flickr album

If I was Beal, I'd wait with bases until Squad starts working on them properly...

Else you might have a disaster similiar to BobCats Lunokhod, which required a special plug-in to work before rovers were added, and since then never really started working properly (I still have some torque issues )
I love that you have labeled one of the bins "smooth jazz".

Beale, you might want to take a look at the proposal on the Russian Moon base:

Flickr album

http://img-fotki.yandex.ru/get/6831/8727165.64/0_12cc44_e51fd0ba_orig.png

I have seen it now! And I am absolutely smitten with it.

Real thanks for linking this.

I feel like every other Moon base proposal it will go nowhere, but let's have some fun with it...

Really need a Fregat for this, but the Fuji tank is a stand-in.

If I was Beal, I'd wait with bases until Squad starts working on them properly...

Else you might have a disaster similiar to BobCats Lunokhod, which required a special plug-in to work before rovers were added, and since then never really started working properly (I still have some torque issues )

Yes, unfortunately this is probably the best method. Stock wheels are badly in need of an overhaul, which hopefully is what Beta is all about. Current setup in Unity is only well understood by a few (I really rely on those few for help making previous wheels) and in-game wheels are too unpredictable (rolling uphill?).

I love that you have labeled one of the bins "smooth jazz".

It gets the Geckos in the mood
I like how in that base they land the Soyuz directly on the Moon. There is nothing Soyuz can't do!
